commands.viewmytasks¶

Classes¶

ViewMyTasks

This class retrieves and displays tasks assigned to a specific user, categorized by completion,

Module Contents¶

class commands.viewmytasks.ViewMyTasks(user_id)[source]¶

This class retrieves and displays tasks assigned to a specific user, categorized by completion, due dates, and pending status.

Why: Ideal for users wanting a personalized view of their tasks, making it easy to track task progress, stay on top of deadlines, and manage workload effectively within Slack.

How: Common usage examples: 1. ViewMyTasks.get_completed_tasks(delta=48): Retrieve tasks completed in the past 48 hours. 2. ViewMyTasks.get_upcoming_tasks(delta=7): Retrieve tasks due in the next 7 days. 3. ViewMyTasks.get_past_due_tasks(): Retrieve overdue tasks. 4. ViewMyTasks.get_list(): Retrieve all current tasks with pending progress.

base_point_block_format[source]¶
user_id[source]¶
payload[source]¶
get_completed_tasks(delta=48)[source]¶

Fetches tasks completed within a specified time frame (default: 48 hours).

Parameters:

delta (int) – Time frame in hours for fetching recently completed tasks.

Returns:

Slack message payload containing recently completed tasks.

Return type:

dict

Why: Allows users to track tasks completed recently, assisting in progress reporting. How: Example usage - ` completed_tasks = my_tasks.get_completed_tasks(delta=24) `

get_upcoming_tasks(delta=7)[source]¶

Fetches tasks due within the next specified number of days (default: 7 days).

Parameters:

delta (int) – Time frame in days for fetching upcoming tasks.

Returns:

Slack message payload containing upcoming tasks.

Return type:

dict

Why: Helps users prioritize tasks due soon, providing visibility on deadlines approaching. How: Example usage - ` upcoming_tasks = my_tasks.get_upcoming_tasks(delta=5) `

get_past_due_tasks()[source]¶

Fetches tasks that are overdue and have not been completed.

Returns:

Slack message payload containing past-due tasks.

Return type:

dict

Why: Alerts users to overdue tasks, helping them catch up and manage pending tasks. How: Example usage - ` past_due_tasks = my_tasks.get_past_due_tasks() `

get_list()[source]¶

Retrieves a list of all tasks that are incomplete, formatted for Slack display.

Returns:

Slack message payload containing all pending tasks for the user.

Return type:

dict

Why: Provides an overview of all outstanding tasks, assisting in task management and prioritization. How: Example usage - ` task_list = my_tasks.get_list() `
